name: Queen Margrethe and Denmark Online Trivia | Royalty & Monarchs | 10 Questions

questions.text: Margrethe's father was King Frederik IX, who is her mother?
questions.explanation:
Ingrid.

	Her mother was Princess Ingrid of Sweden, daughter of King Gustav Adolf of Sweden

Margrethe II.

	Her title is Margrethe II - although she is the first ever ruling Queen in her own right. The first Queen Margrethe was a queen regent in the 14th century.

questions.text: Margrethe's consort is Prince Henrik, what is his original nationality?
questions.explanation:
French.

	He is a former French count and diplomat who changed his name from Henri to Henrik.

questions.text: Queen Margrethe has two sons, what are their names?
questions.explanation:
Frederik and Joachim.

	They are Crown Prince Frederik (named after the previous King) and Prince Joachim.

questions.text: Where does Queen Margrethe officially reside?
questions.explanation:
Amalienborg.

	Amalianborg, Christiansborg and Schackenborg are all homes of different members of the royal family. However, most of Christiansborg is used by the Danish parliament, and the Royal Family has only a few rooms there.  Dannebrog is the royal yacht.

questions.text: Queen Margrethe has a distinguished record in which of the following fields?
questions.explanation:
All of them.

	She has published many literary translations - including 'Lord of the Rings' - and designed theatre sets amongst other achievements.

questions.text: Margrethe's sister Anne-Marie is married to which European royal?
questions.explanation:
Ex-King Constantine of Greece.

	Anne-Marie is married to ex-King Constantine of Greece, making her the sister-in-law of Queen Sophia of Spain, Constantine's sister.

questions.text: Queen Margrethe's nickname within her family is 'Daisy'.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Margrethe has some jewellery in the shape of daisies to mark her nickname. Daisies are also called "marguerites".

Princess Mary.

	Princess Mary - from Tasmania, Australia - is the wife of Margrethe's oldest son, Prince Fredrik. Princess Benedikte is Margrethe's sister, the Danish Queen Mother is Ingrid, and Princess Victoria is crown princess of Sweden.

questions.text: Why did Margrethe's heir Frederik preside at the royal New Year reception for government ministers at the end of 2001?
options: The prince does it by tradition
It was his coming of age
questions.explanation:
She was ill.

	Margrethe was ill, having fallen and cracked two ribs. Her husband Prince Henrik was offended that he was not asked to preside instead.
